Description: Small black-glazed pottery cup-kantharos (Attic?), restored from several fragments, parts of lip missing; glazed black throughout, misfired red in places; convex lip; short, straight neck; globular convex fluted body with three grooved triangles under each handle; handles with angular elbows rising slightly above rim; moulded foot with short concave upper member, convex lower member in two degrees; scraped grooves between the members; deep concave underside with central nipple; scraped groove on resting surface; the glaze is worn and chipped on the exterior.
Curator's comments: Compared by Sparkes and Talcott, Agora 12, with their no. 668, pl. 28 (with p. 110), dated 375 BC to 350 BC.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1249)
